channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Funding the next wave of robotics
item.description: Episode features conversations with two VC's and explores robotics and AI investment trends. The post Funding the next wave of robotics appeared first...

item.title: Lam Research launches collaborative robots to optimize critical maintenance in chip factories
item.description: Lam Research introduced Dextro, the chip industry’s first collaborative robot designed to optimize maintenance in chip factories.

item.title: Solos launches AirGo Vision — ChatGPT-enabled AI smart glasses with a camera
item.description: Solos announced that is launching AirGo Vision, the first smart glasses with ChatGPT-enabled AI and a camera.

item.title: Traders are pretty sure of a Fed rate cut. What happens if inflation data is too hot?
item.description: Traders are pretty confident the Fed will deliver a rate cut next week. What happens if inflation data throws the market a curveball.

item.title: I’m a 59-year-old recluse with PTSD and no living relatives. I have $900,000 in savings. How should I distribute my assets?
item.description: “I have a large bank as trustee, and it will take a large chunk to distribute my estate.”

item.title: Investor optimism for U.S. stocks eclipsing 2000’s dot-com bubble raises ‘negative’ shock risk
item.description: “U.S. consumers have never felt so optimistic about gains in the stock market over the next 12 months,” according to Deutsche Bank Research.

item.title: Defending SOCs Under Siege: Battling Adversarial AI Attacks
item.description: With 77% of enterprises victimized by adversarial AI, the question isn't if your Security Operations Center (SOC) will be targeted—it's when.

item.title: As UnitedHealth shooting puts health insurance in focus, 4 million people could get priced out of coverage if Congress doesn’t act
item.description: Inaction on Capitol Hill could soon make healthcare plans more expensive, potentially adding to the country’s uninsured rate amid rising premiums.
